subject: Economy
topic: GDP at Current Prices and GDP at Constant Prices
question_en: What is the difference between GDP at Current Prices and GDP at Constant Prices?
question_hi: ग्रुप के संख्या पर में और ग्रुप के समय स्थानीय प्रकार से गैर गैर शामिल होती है।
A_en: GDP at Current Prices is the total value of goods and services produced in an economy during a particular period, while GDP at Constant Prices represents the total value after removing inflation effects.
B_en: GDP at Current Prices is the total value of goods and services produced in an economy during a particular period, while GDP at Constant Prices represents the total value after removing inflation effects.
C_en: GDP at Current Prices is the total value of goods and services produced in an economy during a particular period, while GDP at Constant Prices represents the total value after removing inflation effects.

E_en: GDP at Current Prices is the total value of goods and services produced in an economy during a particular period, while GDP at Constant Prices represents the total value after removing inflation effects.
F_en: GDP at Current Prices is the total value of goods and services produced in an economy during a particular period, while GDP at Constant Prices represents the total value after removing inflation effects.
G_en: The difference between GDP at Current Prices and GDP at Constant Prices indicates the change in real economic activity over time due to inflation.
